Authors: Filbert F., Wijaya D.K., Sandatinus D., Atmadja W., Sutanto A.T., Hedwig R.
Title: Microcontroller-based seismic-shakingintensity meter
Affiliations: Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jl K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta 11480, Indonesia; Indonesian Agency for Meteorology, Climatology, and Geophysic, Jl Angkasa 1No. 2 Central, Jakarta, Indonesia

Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta 11480, Indonesia; Atmadja, W., Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jl K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta 11480, Indonesia; Sutanto, A.T., Indonesian Agency for Meteorology, Climatology, and Geophysic, Jl Angkasa 1No. 2 Central, Jakarta, Indonesia; Hedwig, R., Computer Engineering Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jl K.H. Syahdan No. 9, Jakarta 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: A microcontroller-based seismic shaking intensity meter is developed and tested. This device will be mounted in many high rise building that can be found mainly in big city like Jakarta. The device will record information on earthquake s magnitude in the building which is taken by using accelerometer; later on the data will be compared with the real earthquake s magnitude that is taken using seismograph. Data on device position, time, and magnitude level will be sent through Short Message Services (SMS) via Global System for Mobile Communications (GSM) networks to server. The result showed that the accuracy is 95% compared to the commercial seismograph measurement. © 2012 Elsevier B.V.
Author Keywords: Accelerometer; AVR; Earthquake; GSM; Microcontroller; Seismic intensity meter
